## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

# Install and Load Packages

install.packages("tidyverse")
install.packages("sf")
install.packages("spData")
install.packages("ggthemes")
install.packages("ggspatial")
install.packages("Rcpp")

 ```{r, load packages, message=FALSE}
library('tidyverse')
library('sf')
library('spData')
library('ggthemes')
library('ggspatial')
```
#Reading in data sets
```{r read data sets, message=FALSE, results='hide', warning=FALSE}
playgrounds <- st_read("playground locations.geojson")
gardens <- st_read("community gardens.geojson")
historic <- st_read("historic districts.geojson")
```


## Plotting one layer on a map.

```{r simple playground plot}

playground_plot <- ggplot(playgrounds)+
  geom_sf()

playground_plot
```
## Points shape, color, size, transparency

```{r point shapes, include=FALSE}
ggplot(playgrounds)+
  geom_sf(shape=17, color="blue", size=5, alpha=0.1)




```

#Plotting multuple layers

```{r plot three layers}
ggplot(playgrounds) +
  geom_sf() +
  geom_sf(data = historic,
          color="red",
          size=2,
          fill="blue",
          alpha=0.5)+
  geom_sf(data = gardens, color="green")

```

##Adding a legend

```{r}
 ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data=historic, color=NA, alpha=0.5,
          aes(fill="Historic District")) +
  geom_sf(data=playgrounds) +
  geom_sf(data=gardens, color="green") +
  scale_fill_manual(values="blue", name="")

```
#Adding base map
```{r, message=FALSE, results="hide}
ggplot(playgrounds)+
  annotation_map_tile(zoomin=0, progress="none")+
  geom_sf() +
  labs(caption= "Map titles and data OpenStreetMap")


```

#Hotstyle
```{r}
ggplot(playgrounds)+
  annotation_map_tile(zoomin=0, progress="none", type="hotstyle")+
  geom_sf() +
  labs(caption= "Map titles and data OpenStreetMap")
```

#Hikebike

```{r}
ggplot(playgrounds)+
  annotation_map_tile(zoomin=0, progress="none", type="hikebike")+
  geom_sf() +
  labs(caption= "Map titles and data OpenStreetMap")
```

#osmgrayscale

```{r}
ggplot(playgrounds)+

```
